summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with BOP Material Handler Specialist Michael Thomas regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The interview was part of an official OIG investigation into Epstein's death, and Thomas was a staff member assigned to the Special Housing Unit on that day.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) conducted a voluntary interview with BOP staff member Michael Thomas on June 17, 2021, as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein.
Michael Thomas was a Material Handler Specialist assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019, the day Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
Thomas was represented during the interview by attorneys Douglas Mitchell and Montel Figgins, as well as a BOP union representative.
The investigation report includes numerous attachments such as training records, daily assignment rosters, count documentation, and pictures of Epstein's cell.
The document is an official OIG memorandum that contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
